title: Alexander Lukashenko
summary: Alexander Grigoryevich Lukashenko or Alyaksand(a)r Ryhoravich Lukashenka[lower-alpha 1] (born 31 August 1954) is a Belarusian politician who has served as the first and current president of Belarus since the establishment of the office on 20 July 1994, making him as the longest-serving and longest current serving European president.[3] Before his political career, Lukashenko worked as director of a state farm (sovkhoz), and served in the Soviet Border Troops and in the Soviet Army.
